entry.title: Vertex Tax Integration – Restrict Usage to Sales Transactions Only
entry.content:
We are currently observing that tax amounts are returning as zero for customer invoices, even though Vertex is integrated and should be calculating tax correctly on the sales side.

Interestingly, tax amounts and percentages are being returned correctly for vendor invoices, but our business requirement is to use Vertex exclusively for sales-side (customer) transactions, not for purchasing.

We would like to:

  1. Restrict Vertex tax calculation calls to only sales transactions (e.g., customer invoices, sales orders).

  2. Prevent Vertex from being invoked for purchasing transactions (e.g., vendor invoices, purchase orders).

  3. Resolve the issue where customer invoices are returning zero tax, despite Vertex being expected to handle tax calculation.

Please advise on the necessary configuration or user exit/BADI enhancements required to achieve this behavior within SAP.

entry.title: IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS Date type : Dates are not converted into the date type defined in customazing
entry.content:
FM :IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS  & Date type :

Dates from segment E1EDK03 idoc type ORDERS  are not converted into the date type defined in SPRO  "Define item proposal types" (V_TVAK-KPRGBZ).

 

Then error occurs during treatment cause the date format are in days and not in the default date type defined in customazing.

entry.title: Re: Profit Center in Settlement Document | Settlement Man...
entry.content:
You've already tested:

  • Transfer Events 23, 25, 39 → These typically work for header-level or basic item-level data, but don’t support PRCTR override in WB2R_SC context.
  • Transfer Event 65 → Works only for manual creation without material, not for automated settlement via WB2R_SC.

This confirms that standard transfer manager logic is insufficient for your use case.

SAP provides BAdIs specifically designed to inject custom logic into settlement document creation. These are your best bet for redetermining PRCTR dynamically. These BAdIs are documented in SAP Help portal

entry.title: A blocked invoice is not listed in app Release Blocked Invoice (MRBR)
entry.content:
Dear Experts, 

Currently, we are facing to an issue not found a blocked invoice document in release automatically mode (tcode MRBR) in App: Release blocked invoices (SAP Public Cloud)

Steps to reproducing:

Step 1: Create a Purchase Order (PO) via app Create Purchase Order - Advanced
Step 2: Post Invoice document with quantity and amount accordingly quantity and amount in PO via app Create Supplier Invoice - Advanced 
Step 3: Check Invoice status via app Invoice supplier list

The invoice displayed Blocked (Logistics): Yes
Step 4: Release blocked invoice via app Release blocked invoices
If I enter Invoice document number + Fiscal year and choose Release automatically, there is no invoice documents displayed here with message "Blocking reason deleted 0 lines"
If I If I enter Invoice document number + Fiscal year and choose Release manually, the invoice document is displayed and can release

My question is below:

1. Why does the invoice document display in manual release mode but not in automatic release mode? 

2. Could you explain under what circumstances an invoice document can be automatically released in SAP, and what conditions trigger this functionality?

Thank you very much for all your help
Gigi

entry.title: Re: IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS Date type : Dates are not converted...
entry.content:
The root cause of the issue is in Segment E1EDK03 carries date information with qualifiers (IDDAT) like:

  • 001 = Document Date
  • 002 = Delivery Date
  • 022 = Purchase Order Date, etc.

The date format in E1EDK03-DATUM is typically in YYYYMMDD format.

In SPRO → Sales and Distribution → Sales → Sales Documents → Define Item Proposal Types, the field KPRGBZ defines the date type:

  • 1 = Day
  • 2 = Week
  • 3 = Month

If your system expects Week (2) but receives a day-based date, it throws the “period W not valid” error.

To overcome from this, what you can do is ensure that the IDDAT value in E1EDK03 matches the expected date type. For example, If KPRGBZ = 2 (Week), then DATUM should be in YYYYWW format (e.g., 202534 for week 34 of 2025).

Consider exits like EXIT_SAPLVEDA_001 or EXIT_SAPLVEDA_002. In EXIT_SAPLVEDA_001, you can intercept the E1EDK03 segment and convert the incoming date to the correct format based on KPRGBZ. You will need to adjust this logic to match your specific IDDAT and KPRGBZ settings.

Finally, in TVAK, ensure that the checkbox “Default PO Date” (BSTVO) is not overriding your IDoc input. The date type (KPRGBZ) is consistent with what your IDoc is sending.

For any reasons, if you are not willing to go with the above custom validation or modifying the user exit is not feasible, consider preprocessing the IDoc using a custom function module or middleware logic to convert the date format before it reaches IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS and adjust the segment E1EDK03-DATUM accordingly

entry.title: Withholding tax items not visible until invoice is paid
entry.content:
Dear community,

I am working with the Run Statutory Reports application, specifically in the area of withholding tax reporting in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud. Within the section Manage Withholding Tax Items, I can see withholding tax entries, but only for invoices that have already been paid.

In my case, I am working in Spain with the statutory models, particularly Modelo 111. From a legal and compliance perspective, it would be more accurate to display all withholding tax items at the time of invoicing, regardless of whether the invoice has been paid or not.

Interestingly, when I generate the .txt file for the statutory report, it does include the invoices that are posted but not yet paid, and the output file is correct. The issue seems to be only with the Manage Withholding Tax Items application, which displays withholding tax items only after payment

I hope you can help me.

Regards.

entry.title: Re: Vertex Tax Integration – Restrict Usage to Sales Tran...
entry.content:
In EXIT_SAPLFYTX_USER_001, you can add logic to skip Vertex invocation for purchasing transactions by checking the document type or transaction origin.

If Vertex is integrated but returning zero tax, it’s likely due to missing or incorrect data elements being passed to Vertex.

Though you would have checked the below areas, still worth checking again

Pricing Procedure: Ensure condition types examples like YTXE, YTGT, YTXD are correctly configured to trigger Vertex. Access Sequence: Confirm that tax-relevant fields (e.g., jurisdiction, material tax classification) are populated. Customer & Material Master: Validate tax classification indicators are set correctly. Ensure the correct date (e.g., GI date vs. order date) is passed to Vertex. You can control this via EXIT_SAPLFYTX_USER_001.

Also check if custom Requirement Routines like 939 or 949 is used in the pricing procedure to avoid mandatory tax errors or exclusions.

So the summary of actions would be

entry.title: First Experiences GenAI-driven extensibility assistant for Custom Fields and Custom Logic app
entry.content:
These are my first experiences with the extensibility assistant

Use within Custom Fields:


You can call the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields app start screen, and in the details screen of a single custom field.

Calling the extensibility assistant in the start screen:

Example Prompt :Create a Z field in the Journal Entry Item Level , Field Name : Reference1 and Field Description : Reference 1_HD , Data Type : Char/Text Field Length : 20 and Enable it for the RAP BO I_JOURNALENTRYTP

In the initial screen of the Custom Fields app on the button bar at the top right of the custom field list, you'll find a open assistant button. 

Enter the prompt it will preselect Business context

 After selecting the right context accept the proposal from SAP it will create the field and enable to edit for detail screen 

Calling the extensibility assistant in the details screen:

  • On the button bar at the bottom of the screen, you'll find the diamond button.

  • if you want to ask about a custom field displayed on the details screen, you can refer to it using expressions like “this field”. A common use case is seeking assistance to expose the field through an OData service, UI, CDS view, or SOAP API.

  • Once selected Press save and publish manually . As you see from the below the field is automatically extended in the SOAP API section based on the prompt .

 

Use within Custom Logic:

  • Start the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic app by clicking the Open Assistant button on the implementations table toolbar

 

  •  The extensibility assistant will show a list of BAdIs that fit your request or a message if no BAdIs were found. 

Select and create implementation . This will only help to find right BADIs not generation of the coding in the BADI 🙂

entry.title: Re: A blocked invoice is not listed in app Release Blocke...
entry.content:
To answer your question, Why does the invoice appear in manual release but not in automatic release?, is the key difference lies in how SAP interprets the blocking reason and whether it qualifies for automatic release.

So if your invoice is blocked due to a logistics reason (e.g., GR/IR mismatch, missing goods receipt), it may not qualify for automatic release unless the system detects that the issue has been resolved and falls within configured tolerances. Having said that, SAP will only release blocked invoices automatically if all blocking reasons are resolved and the invoice meets the following conditions:

  • Price or quantity variance is within tolerance limits (configured in SPRO under Logistics Invoice Verification)
  • Goods receipt has been posted, if GR-based invoice verification is active
  • No manual payment block is set on the invoice
  • Invoice is not flagged for approval or workflow hold

If any of these conditions are not met, the invoice will not appear in automatic mode, even if it can be released manually.

So what you can do is check the blocking reason in the invoice document (via MIR4 or the app) and confirm whether it's system-determined or manually set. Review your tolerance settings in configuration (SPRO → Materials Management → Logistics Invoice Verification → Incoming Invoice → Set Tolerance Limits). Ensure that GR has been posted and matches the invoice quantity. Avoid setting manual blocks unless necessary.

entry.title: Re: Migration to SAP S/4HANA: What happens to VKM5?
entry.content: VKM5 is still technically available in S/4HANA, but it is considered part of the classic credit management framework. SAP strongly recommends transitioning to FSCM Credit Management (Financial Supply Chain Management), which uses Documented Credit Decisions (DCD) and newer apps like UKM_MY_DCDS. In fact, in SAP note 3315948, it is very clearly mentioned that "VKM5 transaction existed on ECC Classic credit management with a specific scope to list all deliveries, which are blocked, released or credit limit check was OK. With SAP Credit Management (FSCM) there is no separate transaction or authorization object to list DCDs only for deliveries. So, instead of VKM5 in ECC, you have check UKM_MY_DCDS in S/4Hana

entry.title: SAP NOW AI SP 2025
entry.content:
Estar no SAP NOW AI 2025, em São Paulo, nos dias 19 e 20 de agosto, foi uma experiência extremamente positiva. A Localiza esteve muito bem representada no SAP NOW AI 2025, reforçando não só seu compromisso com as principais tendências de inovação e inteligência artificial, mas também representando com orgulho a comunidade SAP de Belo Horizonte. Foi uma participação que evidenciou o quanto estamos conectados com o que há de mais atual no mercado e engajados em construir soluções relevantes junto ao ecossistema SAP.

O evento trouxe conteúdos relevantes, cases inspiradores e ótimas oportunidades de aprendizado e atualização. Além disso, foi um espaço valioso para fortalecer o networking com profissionais e parceiros do ecossistema SAP, trocando experiências e visões sobre o futuro dos negócios.

Quem mais participou do evento? Do que mais gostaram? Abração proceis!

 



Fica aqui meu convite para que a comunidade SAP de Belo Horizonte continue se aproximando e se mantendo ativa. Quanto mais conectados estivermos, mais preparados estaremos para construir soluções relevantes e transformar o mercado juntos.

entry.title: Re: Dynamic error message is getting repeated in ME21N
entry.content:
Have you discussed with your technical team on this? I am sure, they should be able to address this.

For information, SAP’s message handling in this BADI doesn’t automatically overwrite older messages, so you have to manage it explicitly.

Implement your logic in the method PROCESS_ITEM or CHECK, depending on when you want the validation to trigger. Before adding a new error message, clear any previous ones related to the GL account.

entry.title: Re: I want to implement BADI for Tamil Nadu Ptax multiple...
entry.content:
Yes the BAdI what you mentioned is perfect. Instead of relying only on the 99 groupings in the system, this BAdI typically has a method like GET_GROUPING, lets you write your own logic to decide which grouping an employee belongs to. So now, even if you have 150 or 200 groupings, you can handle it using this enhancement. For example, the logic can be in such a way that

  • if the employee is in Chennai and earns ₹30,000, assign Group A.
  • if the employee is in Coimbatore and earns ₹50,000, assign Group B.
  • And so on…

In fact, you can use meaningful names like TN_CHENNAI_01 instead of just 01. Discuss with your ABAP team

entry.title: Re: Ks53 display master data profit center: status modified
entry.content:
Hello @rivetz 

This issue arises from inconsistent validity intervals on the profit centre. KE53 shows it as active, but the Fiori master data views consider it inactive if the validity periods overlap or have gaps.

Possible Solution:

  • Open Manage Profit Centers.
  • Adjust the validity, so there’s one continuous period, example 01.01.2025 – 31.12.9999.
  • Re-save the valid period with the Active flag checked.

This will remove the inactive display from master data views.

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3525679

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Situation Handling Extended framework (Email notifica...
entry.content:
Hello @Sanjay_BS1 

To enable email notifications for your Situation Handling using the extended framework in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, please follow these steps

Ensure Users Enable Email Notifications:
Users must activate the email notification option in their Fiori Launchpad user settings profile → notifications → enable Echo to email.

Configure Recipients in Situation Types:
In Manage Situation Types – Extended, Define recipients under the Recipients tab. Assign users, teams, or responsibility roles with valid email addresses.

Verify Notification Channel Setup:
Verify that the email notification channel is correctly configured and active in your system. Your administrators should review outbound email integration and the scheduling of notification jobs.

Optional – Use Email Templates:
If needed, customise the notification email format in the Maintain Email Templates app.

By completing these configurations, email notifications for your defined situations will be triggered alongside Fiori launchpad alerts.

For detailed guidance, see:

SAP Help: Situation Handling Extended Framework

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Visual studio, sap cloud application extension, syste...
entry.content:
Hi,
You only need to do this once, it seems that (finally) the settings are transfered when updating to the next release version of the extension. So if you only have a handful of connections, it is easier (and safer) to just enter them manually. But if you want to copy them, the configuration is now in %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\VisualStudio\<<version>>\privateregistry.bin
To edit it, you need to load it in the registry editor (make a backup of this file first!).

  1. Launch RegEdit
  2. Select the Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
  3. Select the File-Load Hive... menu item, and load the privateregistry.bin, choose some name
  4. Replace the <ConnectionDataSet>...</ConnectionDataSet> part in the SystemConnections under <<name>>\Software\Microsoft\VisualStudio\<<version>>\ApplicationPrivateSettings\SAP\Copernicus\CopernicusOptionPage.
  5. When finished select the <<name>> hive and select File-Unload Hive before opening the VS

entry.title: Re: Even after implementation of Note 359691 , Fields are...
entry.content:
Even after implementing Note 359691, the fields shown in drilldown reports depend on:

  • Report definition and layout (not just technical availability)
  • Column sets and characteristics defined in the report
  • Whether the fields are populated with values in the dataset

SAP suppresses fields in drilldown reports if:

  • They are not part of the report definition
  • They are blank across all records
  • They are not included in the column set or layout variant

What you can do is go to GRR1 or GRR2 (Report Painter/Writer), confirm that the missing fields are included in the report structure.
Use GS12 to inspect the column set used in your report. Add the missing fields manually if needed

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
Hello again,

I have received following reply from sso:

When Universal ID migration will be launched - one the first login user will be prompted to set separate SAP ID password for each user linked to Universal ID (Unique on inherit from current Universal ID password).

Login process would happen without redirection to Universal ID password and user selection screen(like on help.sap.com currently). SAP ID (S0008739488, S0026959831  etc.) and dedicated password will need to be used for login. This currently works on help.sap.com.

Account.sap.com still remains needed as SAP ID/password manager and for learning.sap.com/community.sap.com as an exception.

This does not really clear anything for me and raises even more concerns. I am now understanding:

  • SAP discards Universal ID
  • We are back to S/P/C users and have to (again) reset passwords upon go-live of the migration
  • Preexisting s-users (before UID was introduced) might still have passwords, but we are again required to set these passwords again once there is go-live of the migration
  • All applications (e.g. BTP based) have to update user records in default IdP from email (UID) to s-user.
  • SAP Learning - as usual - is behind and will continue to use UID and account.sap.com 

Please correct me if anything here is wrong. We have requested further references and guidance on this. At first I even thought the mailsap.com message was phishing but this all sounds like a half-baked design and approach.

Best regards

Our current system setup includes:

  • FI-CA Release 618 – which is listed as VALID FOR in the note.
  • SAP_BASIS Release 750 – which is listed as NOT VALID FOR in the note.

Your guidance will help us determine whether to proceed with implementation or await a compatible version.

entry.title: Re: Withholding tax items not visible until invoice is paid
entry.content:
Hello @AlvaroFernandezMorales 

The Manage Withholding Tax Items app displays withholding tax items exclusively for paid invoices. This behaviour is expected since the app emphasises tax relevance at the payment moment, aligning with particular statutory reporting needs.

However, for statutory models like Spain’s Modelo 111, where reporting is mandatory at invoice posting regardless of payment status, the statutory report output .txt file correctly includes invoices posted but not yet paid. This proves that the back end calculation and extraction logic are correctly set up.

Unfortunately, the Manage Withholding Tax Items app cannot currently display withholding tax items for unpaid invoices due to limitations in its UI design and filtering capabilities.

What you can do:

Continue using the statutory report file for accurate legal compliance, as it records all relevant withholding tax items at invoicing

Provide feedback to SAP through the Influence or Improvement Request channels, requesting a UI update to also display withholding tax items when posting an invoice..

Review the 'Check Withholding Tax Settings and Simulate Calculation' app for further insights into withholding tax data visibility.

For comprehensive guidance on withholding tax setup and reporting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, please refer to

SAP Help: Check Withholding Tax Settings and Simulate Calculation

General withholding tax configuration overview

If the application object is active but not visible in your Output Parameters app dropdown, as shown in your screenshot, please check the above points, paying particular attention to user authorisations and the use of dedicated balance confirmation apps rather than the generic OPD app.

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Flexible Workflow in Sales Documents
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: IDOC SHPMNT05 DEL not possible because HUs and delive...
entry.content:
Try with the below steps

Option-1 Use a Custom IDoc Inbound Processing Routine

Enhance the IDoc inbound function module (typically IDOC_INPUT_SHPMNT) to:

  • Intercept the SHPMNT05 with action code DEL
  • Check for linked deliveries and HUs
  • Trigger logic to unlink them before proceeding with deletion

This could involve:

  • Calling SD_SHIPMENT_DELIVERY_DELETE to remove deliveries
  • Using HU_PACKING_UNPACK or similar to unpack HUs
  • Resetting shipment status if needed (e.g., from “planned” to “created”)

This approach ensures the deletion request from TMS doesn’t fail, even if the shipment is still linked.

Option 2: Use Workflow or Background Job

If you want to keep IDoc processing lean, you can:

let the SHPMNT05 IDoc create a deletion request (e.g., store in a Z-table)
Run a background job or workflow that:

  • Unpacks HUs
  • Unlinks deliveries
  • Deletes the shipment using standard BAPI or transaction

This decouples the deletion logic from the IDoc itself, giving you more control and error handling.

Option 3: Preprocess Deliveries in TMS Before Sending IDoc

If possible, configure the external TMS to send a SHPMNT05 update IDoc first that removes deliveries. Then send a SHPMNT05 deletion IDoc. This two-step approach avoids SAP-side complexity but depends on TMS flexibility.

entry.title: SAP Business Technology Platform Blue-Green Deployment Approach in SAP BTP Cloud foundry
entry.content:
What is Blue-Green Deployment?

Blue-Green Deployment in SAP BTP Cloud Foundry is a reliable strategy for updating applications with zero downtime and minimal risk. The concept revolves around maintaining two identical environments:

  • Blue – the current live environment actively serving users.

  • Green – the new version of the application, deployed in parallel for testing and validation.

While end-users continue working in the Blue environment, developers can safely deploy and verify the updated application in Green. This allows for functional testing, performance checks, and integration validation without affecting live operations.

Once the Green environment is confirmed to be stable and fully functional, traffic is seamlessly redirected from Blue to Green, making it the new production environment. If any issues arise after the switch, rollback is straightforward—traffic can quickly be pointed back to Blue, ensuring business continuity.

SAP BTP supports this deployment approach through the Cloud Foundry CLI and Multi-Target Application (MTA) deployment tools, making it particularly well-suited for rolling out updates to mission-critical business applications where even a few minutes of downtime is unacceptable. This method not only improves release reliability but also enhances user confidence in the stability of new updates.

Key Advantages:

  • Zero Downtime Deployments
  • Quick Rollback
  • Improved Business Continuity

Restriction:

Blue Green deployment is supported only for cloud foundry application. It is not supported for there bounded services, such as workflow content and HTM5 repository content and others. 

I assume that you have knowledge of:


1. Knowledge of SAP BTP CAPM development.
2. SAP BTP Cloud Foundry
3. Basic Postman
4. OData API understanding.

Demonstration:

Step 1:


Assume you're working on a BTP CAPM project that has already been deployed in the Cloud Foundry environment. Below is a screenshot of a basic CAPM project containing two entities:
Books and Authors

 

Step 2:


Below is a screenshot of Cloud Foundry Space, showing the live services

Step 3:


Below is a screenshot of calling the service using Postman:

Step 4:


The above CAP project has been built and deployed in the Cloud Foundry environment. A new requirement has now been introduced to create an additional entity named 'E-Books'

Modify the entity and service .cds file as below:

You can test the services locally by executing Command: “cds watch”

Step 5:

Now, we build the project using
1.CLI: cds build –production. OR
2.Right Click MTA file and build.

The Build will start:

Step 6:


After the build is finished, change the directory to "mta_archives", using command:

 >>>  cd mta_archives

 

Step 7:

We will now use the Blue-Green deployment strategy to carry out testing before promoting the changes to the live environment.

Please note we need to make use of CLI to use the strategy.

Command format:
>>>>> cf deploy <your-mta-archive-v2> --strategy blue-green

Actual Command (for the project):
>>>>  cf deploy BlueGreenDemo_v1_1.0.0.mtar --strategy blue-green

 

Step 8:

The deployment process will begin shortly. You can monitor its progress—a new service instance with the suffix -idle will be created as part of the Blue-Green deployment strategy

Finally, the service are now deployed.

Save the following commands, as this specifies the process ID’s of blue green deployment.
Use "cf deploy -i 2355087a-572f-11f0-aeea-eeee0a8c175e -a abort" to abort the process.
Use "cf deploy -i 2355087a-572f-11f0-aeea-eeee0a8c175e -a resume" to resume the process.process.
Hint: Use the "--skip-testing-phase" option of the deploy command to skip this phase.

Hint: Incase the above process id is lost because of terminal closed. You can get the process id using command
>>>>> cf mta-ops

Also, the above shows the status that action is required for MTA to either be aborted or resumed.

Step 9:

Check under the cloud foundry dev space in SAP BTP:
As seen in the screenshot below:
We have and Idle and live services running.

Step 10:

Check the service status using CLI :
Command: cf apps

Let’s test the idle service using postman:
The Idle service has 3 entities defined in it:
1.Books
2.Authors
3.Ebooks

 

Let’s check the live services as of now:
The live services are still showing 2 entities:
1.Authors
2.Books


Step 11:


Let check the commands that were saved during the deployment:
Use "cf deploy -i 2355087a-572f-11f0-aeea-eeee0a8c175e -a abort" to abort the process.

The above command is used to abort the deployment process. This is typically done when the changes deployed to the idle service do not meet the requirements. In such cases, the deployment process can be safely aborted without affecting the live environment, thereby preventing unintended changes from being promoted to production and preventing the effort of reverting the changes.
However please note:
This action does not perform a rollback, and the state of apps, routes and services remains unchanged. Depending on your needs, you might want to remove the new app versions and the temporary routes.
Let’s use the command to see the effects of:
As soon as you use the command, the process is aborted:

However, the idle routes are still available and active

Use "cf deploy -i 2355087a-572f-11f0-aeea-eeee0a8c175e -a resume" to resume the process

The deployment starts again:

Checking in the Cloud foundry the idle and live service are not removed and a live service is activated.

 

References:

1. Implementing Blue-Green Deployment with SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime for Zero Downtime Updates 

2. Blue-Green-Deployment-strategy

entry.title: Re: User ID for IAS users
entry.content:
Hi

The userName should not be your key attribute in order to use as a key to your cloud applications. Your key attribute has to be the Global User ID. You can find the details here: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/global-user-id-and-sap-ias-essentials-for-ai-integration-in-sap-landscape/ba-p/14067941

This is mandatory for some cloud apps already like Task Center and Joule.

If non-employees will be created manually in IAS yo don't need to care about the UserName Attribute since it is not mandatory in IAS, you should use UUID as the key identifier and that's automatically created and unique in IAS.

entry.title: Warehouse number created wrongly with 3 digits, is this permitted or must be 4 digits?
entry.content:
While setting up the organizational data for Warehouse Management in the Public Cloud for the location, the warehouse number was created with only 3 digits instead of the usual 4 digits. Since this can no longer be changed in CBC after creating the organizational units, I would like to confirm:

Can a warehouse number with 3 digits cause issues in Warehouse Management configuration or operations?

Is there a way to adjust the number after creation, or is a 3-digit warehouse number permitted?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Warehouse number created wrongly with 3 digits, is th...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

Although traditionally we prefer to use 3 digits number for ERP warehouse and 4 digits number for EWM warehouse. It is acceptable to use 3 digits number as warehouse number. There would be no issue with the Warehouse Management configuration or operations.

entry.title: Re: I am not able to see required learning assignments in...
entry.content:
We have experienced this often. From what SAP tells us, the Home Page (BizX) can get out of sync with the LMS. This results in incorrect information in the "For You Today" section of the Home Page.

Whenever we report this to SAP they ask us for user IDs. They then investigate, which sometimes takes up to a week, and then they will usually either re-sync the individual, or if you give them enough examples, they will re-sync the entire system. 

Either way is reactionary - there does not seem to be any process to ensure the 2 systems stay in sync. It depends on learners reporting the issue to us, and then us reporting to SAP. Meanwhile the learners are either missing new assignments or seeing assignments that they have already completed.

entry.title: Re: Implementing UI5 Search Field for Virtual Elements
Re: Implementing UI5 Search Field for Virtual Elements
entry.content:
With all due respect @Ram_Gnaneshwaran_Babu this is a very bad idea. The whole concept behind Hana and the SADL framework is to allow the database layer to do all the filtering, pagination, sorting, etc. Front-end filtering would only work in a very restricted situations.

Let's say a user does a search that matches 200,000 records in the database. The Fiori framework returns the first 20 records (or whatever the default result-set maximum is). Your front-end filtering then filters out 5 of the 20 records returned from the backend and displays 15 records. The user will then think there were only 15 records matching their query. They never get to see the next 20 result set, or the rest of the 200,000 matches.

For your front-end filtering to work correctly, you will need to force the backend to return all 200,000 matches. And that breaks the principle of the Fiori application framework.

You should at least mention that this only works if the total number of matches is very small, ie less than number of each result-set returned from the backend.

entry.title: Re: About: Configuring the Output of Balance Confirmations
entry.content:
Hello @Jonas_Schulz 

Thank you for the clarification that you are working with SAP S/4HANA Pub cloud edition.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, if the balance confirmation application object type FIN_FO_BLNC_CNFRM is active but you cannot see it in the Output Parameter Determination (OPD) application when defining rules, please consider these points

  • Limited Display in OPD App:
    The OPD app in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition often shows a subset of application objects by default. Some objects, like balance confirmations, may require additional configuration steps outside the OPD app or appear under different naming or grouping.
  • Use the App Manage Output Parameters Specifically for Balance Confirmation:
    For balance confirmation in the cloud, SAP recommends using dedicated apps such as:
    • Manage Balance Confirmations
    • Configure Balance Confirmation Output Types

These apps manage output parameter assignment and output handling more directly than the generic OPD app.

Check the Business Catalogues and Roles:
Ensure the business roles assigned to your user have the appropriate authorisations to manage balance confirmation output parameters. Sometimes, missing roles can restrict visibility in OPD.

Cloud-Specific Configuration
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the configuration and activation of application objects and output parameters are often centralised in configuration apps accessed via the Manage Your Solution or Implementation Projects Fiori apps.
You may need to confirm that the balance confirmation scenario is fully activated as part of your scope item configuration.

Consult SAP Best Practice Documentation:
For balance confirmation, SAP provides scope items and configuration guides that outline output management details cloud
https://help.sap.com/doccs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Switching Cloud Identity tenant in Subaccount Trust C...
entry.content:
Hi @anotherbasicguy 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, switching your Cloud Identity tenant via OIDC Trust in a subaccount on SAP BTP is an official and supported SAP feature. You can safely edit the trust configuration to point to a new Cloud Identity tenant without impacting user IDs or authorizations. During the switch, the application registration is automatically moved from the old tenant to the new one.

This functionality is designed to support tenant re-organization or multi-tenant management and is documented in SAP Cloud Identity Services’ tenant management guides.

For detailed reference, I suggest you review the following pages:

Reuse SAP Cloud Identity Services Tenants for Different Customer Ids

Remapping an Identity Authentication Tenant guidance

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Agenda : SAP Inside Track Hyderabad 2025 2nd Edition
entry.content:
3 Tracks

3 Panel Discussion 

20 Speakers 

There will be 3 tracks 

Venue :  CMR Institute of Technology 

https://maps.app.goo.gl/cFr44eqzPskFUxzg8

1. Analytics Track

Located in the Central Auditorium, this track covers analytics and data. The agenda includes a panel discussion on S/4HANA & AI synergy, and a session on the Open Era of SAP Analytics. Attendees will also learn about reskilling for S/4HANA and Embedded Analytics, as well as AI-driven analytics and the integration of S4HANA + DataSphere.

2. AI Track

This track, held in Seminar Hall 153, focuses on artificial intelligence within the SAP ecosystem. Topics include an introduction to AI in SAP, automated controls, and Generative AI for SAP GRC. The afternoon sessions cover transforming SAP with AI agents and intelligent enterprise, followed by a discussion on AI-driven SAP auditing.

 

3. S/4HANA Track

This track, in Seminar Hall 159, is dedicated to SAP S/4HANA. Sessions cover predictions for intelligent enterprises, unifying the cloud with SAP BTP, and building modern apps with RAP and CAP. A panel discussion on the future of autonomous agents and a session on ERP Copilots are also featured.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on SAP Note 3025049 Compatibility with...
entry.content:
Perhaps, a Basis team can rightly guide you and not sure, whether you already checked this.

So coming to your query, below are my thoughts

System-Level Incompatibility:
Yes, when a note lists a component (like SAP_BASIS 750) under “NOT VALID FOR,” it usually indicates that the note contains code or configuration that is incompatible with that release. This could be due to missing framework support, deprecated functions, or architectural changes in that version.

Impact on Implementation:
Attempting to implement the note on an incompatible SAP_BASIS release may result in errors during import, runtime failures, or unintended behavior. Even if FI-CA 618 is compatible, the underlying BASIS layer must support the technical objects and logic introduced by the note.

To my knowledge, as of now, there is no officially documented workaround or alternative note that directly supports SAP_BASIS 750 for Note 3025049. However, here are some steps you can take:

Check SAP Note 3052143:
Since 3025049 is a prerequisite for 3052143, review 3052143 itself to see if it offers compatibility guidance or alternative prerequisites for SAP_BASIS 750.

Use SAP Expert Search:
In the SAP ONE Support Launchpad, use the Expert Search to filter notes by component and release. You might find a variant or newer note that supports your BASIS version.

Raise an Incident ticket with SAP:
If this functionality is critical, consider raising a support ticket with SAP. They may offer a workaround, a custom correction, or confirm whether a future note will support SAP_BASIS 750.

entry.title: Re: Material Documents Overview app key features - S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

I have these comments on this topic, what do you think about them? 

In the new application "Material Document Overview", compared to the old MB51 transaction, I’m missing the color indication of movements as plus (+) or minus (−), or at least a value that clearly shows whether it’s a positive or negative movement.
The new application includes a "Debit/Credit" field, but it’s an additional field, and sometimes it’s not very intuitive.

I also miss the "Total" and "Subtotal" values – these helped users easily check, for example, the SUM for a given material or movement.

Additionally, I’m missing a separate field for the material number – currently, it only shows the material name and number combined, which makes filtering and analysis more difficult.

Thanks for answers, Monika

entry.title: Re: Fiori bookmark storage in SAP
entry.content:
Hi @jeandaniel_keller198 

Thank you for the question. Let me walk you through.

Fiori bookmarks metadata is stored primarily in SAP BW tables like RSZWBOOKMARK header and RSIXWWW clustered data where parameter values are stored compressed. It is very complex to directly read bookmark details from these tables which is due to compression.

In S/4HANA and Fiori, bookmark or favourites data is not stored in a straightforward table but managed by UI services and personalization. For troubleshooting dumps caused by invalid stored bookmarks, I suggest you consider examining RSZWBOOKMARK for metadata and analyse the dump traces for invalid bookmark references.

For S/4HANA Cloud systems, use Fiori apps or personalization export or import functions for managing bookmarks.

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Manage Bookmarks

entry.title: Re: IDOC SHPMNT05 DEL not possible because HUs and delive...
entry.content:
IDOC_INPUT_SHPMNT - Yes, this is a standard SAP function module used for inbound processing of shipment IDocs (type SHPMNT05).
SD_SHIPMENT_DELIVERY_DELETE - may be you can try with WS_DELIVERY_UPDATE

The other easiest way to find out the available FMs is go to SE84, to search by:

  • Function group (e.g., V51E, LE_SHP_DELIVERY_PROC)
  • Class (e.g., CL_DELIVERY_PROCESSING)
  • Enhancement spot (e.g., ES_SHP_DELIVERY_UPDATE)

This gives you a broader view of what's available in your release.

entry.title: Re: De-provisioning in SAP analytics cloud from GRC AC vi...
entry.content:
Hello @Abhinay_Nampally 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the balance confirmation application object FIN_FO_BLNC_CNFRM might be active but not visible in the Output Parameter Determination app due to application or authorisation restrictions.

To properly manage balance confirmation output parameters, please utilise dedicated apps such as Manage Balance Confirmations and Configure Balance Confirmation Output Types.

Make sure the balance confirmation scenario is included in your scope and that your user roles have the necessary authorisations.

For comprehensive guidance, please consult the official SAP documentation.
Balance Confirmation - Output Management Configuration

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Setting Up Individual Goals in PMGM with Varying Targ...
entry.content: Hi,

entry.title: Re: SAP Course not available - Simplify Integration with...
entry.content:
Hi @MichaelSeydler 

The earlier SAP course has been retired. SAP now offers a more comprehensive “SAP Integration Suite” course covering integration suite fundamentals, iFlow design, adapters, security, API management, and event-driven integration.

This course is available online with live and recorded sessions, offering a practical, hands-on approach to SAP integration on the Business Technology Platform.

You can find more details and if you desire enroll for the courses via the following:

SAP’s official training platform: SAP Integration Suite CLD900

Practical integration courses with exercises: Practical SAP Integration Suite

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Community - Where are you from?
entry.content:
Hallo zusammen,
ich komme aus Niederbayern, bin ein Logiker, Taktiker und Stratege und ich habe viele Jahre Logistik Prozesse optimiert und standarisiert und meine IT Kollegen haben es entsprechend im SAP Modelliert.
Nun habe ich beschlossen mich ein wenig weiter zu bilden und hoffe auf eure Hilfe.
Meine Standardbewerbung:
Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren,
mit großem Interesse verfolge ich die Entwicklungen in [Branche des Unternehmens,
falls bekannt, z.B. "der produzierenden Industrie" oder "im Bereich Logistik und Supply
Chain"] und bin überzeugt, dass meine einzigartige Kombination aus tiefgreifender
operativer Expertise, strategischem Denken und nachweislichen Erfolgen in der
Prozessoptimierung und digitalen Transformation einen wertvollen Beitrag zu Ihren
ambitionierten Zielen leisten kann.
Mein Profil entspricht keinem traditionellen Akademiker, sondern dem eines Logikers,
Taktikers und Strategen , der darauf spezialisiert ist, komplexe
Wertschöpfungsketten zu durchdringen und die Brücke zwischen strategischen
Anforderungen und deren erfolgreicher operativer Realisierung zu schlagen. Ich
erfasse praktische Anforderungen präzise, übersetze sie in Konzepte und befähige
Spezialisten zur Umsetzung. Meine Qualifikationen als Industriemeister (IHK) und
Logistikmeister (IHK) untermauern meine umfassende praktische Erfahrung und
statten mich mit einem praxisorientierten Ansatz zur Problemlösung und
Implementierung aus.
Meine Expertise – Beitrag zu innovativen Lösungen:
Als treibende Kraft bei der BMW AG habe ich maßgeblich zur digitalen Transformation und
operativen Exzellenz beigetragen. Meine Expertise in der SAP-Bestandsführung und
Logistikautomatisierung, basierend auf über 17 Jahren praktischer
SAP-Anwendungserfahrung (davon 6 Jahre als Key User Vertreter für 3 Werke), führte zu
messbaren Verbesserungen:
Ich initiierte und leitete die Steigerung der SAP-Bestandsgenauigkeit von 74% auf
beeindruckende 98% für 24.000 Sachnummern in drei Werken. Dies erreichte ich durch die
Implementierung fortschrittlicher E-Kanban- und Scan-Systeme, einschließlich robotischer
Lösungen zur automatischen Erfassung und direkten SAP-Rückmeldung, sowie die Integration
des SAP PKMC-Moduls zur vollautomatisierten Bestandssteuerung. Meine Kenntnisse
umfassen dabei auch die Optimierung der Minimal-Maximal-Bestandssteuerung (Min-Max),
Kanban und des MRP-Laufs, sowie die spezifischen SAP-Verfahren für Hausteile, JIT- und
JIS-Teile. Diese Maßnahmen eliminierten kritische COGI- und JITB-Meldungen, führten zur
Abschaffung von rund 40 "Sonderfahrten" pro Monat und resultierten in direkten monatlichen
Einsparungen von ca. 50.000 € durch die Reduzierung von Fehlern und manuellen Prozessen.
Meine Einblicke in die SAP-Implementierung bei Hirotec ergänzen mein Verständnis für die
Einführung neuer Geschäftsprozesse im SAP Logistik Umfeld.
Darüber hinaus konzipierte und realisierte ich ein wegweisendes Pilotprojekt für ein
WPS-fähiges Automated Storage and Retrieval System (ASRS), das konzernweit Einsparungen
in dreistelliger Millionenhöhe seit der Einführung von 2013-2025 generiert. Diese
nachweislichen Erfolge spiegeln meine Kompetenz wider, Prozesseffizienz und Datenqualität
signifikant zu steigern und somit die Resilienz und Wettbewerbsfähigkeit von Lieferketten
nachhaltig zu stärken – ein direkter Beitrag zu BMWs iFACTORY-Strategie und der globalen
Digitalisierung der Produktionslogistik.
Als erfahrener Team- und Projektleiter (u.a. bei der BMW AG mit bis zu 50
Mitarbeitern) koordiniere ich erfolgreich Fachbereiche, IT-Teams und externe Partner.
Meine Fähigkeit, Schnittstellen zu optimieren und Prozesse zu standardisieren,
befähigt Fachabteilungen, reibungslos zu arbeiten und trägt maßgeblich zur Effizienz
der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette bei. Ich bin versiert darin, cross-funktionale
Teams zu motivieren und zu exzellenten Ergebnissen zu führen.
Meine Rolle als Bestandsanalytiker und N.I.O. Analyst bei BMW, wo ich
Prozessschnittstellen analysierte und optimierte, unterstreicht meine starken
analytischen und konzeptionellen Fähigkeiten, die für die Lösung komplexer
Herausforderungen unerlässlich sind.
Mein Werdegang:
● 09/1992 – 07/1995 | Hauptschule, Dingolfing
○ Erfolgreicher qualifizierender Hauptschulabschluss.
● 09/1995 – 07/1998 | Ausbildung zum Elektroinstallateur |
Hans-Glas-Berufsschule, Dingolfing
○ Ausbildung nach der Zwischenprüfung abgebrochen, da der Arbeitgeber
insolvent wurde und das Tätigkeitsfeld nicht den langfristigen beruflichen
Vorstellungen entsprach.
● 08/1998 – 10/2000 | Wareneingang & SAP Lagerverwaltung | Uni-Data
○ 2 Jahre Erfahrung in der Lagerverwaltung mit SAP im Wareneingang.
● 11/2000 – 07/2015 | Bestandsanalyse / Teamleiter Physische Logistik | BMW
AG, Dingolfing
○ Verantwortlich für die Analyse, Optimierung und Automatisierung von
Material- und Bestandsflüssen zur Steigerung der Effizienz und Datenqualität
in der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette.
○ Führte ein Team und agierte als Key User Vertreter für 3 Werke, vermittelte
Prozessverständnis an IT-Spezialisten zur erfolgreichen Automatisierung
komplexer SAP-Prozesse.
○ Sicherstellung der Präzision und strategischen Weiterentwicklung der
Bestandsführung und Logistik.
○ Aktive Zusammenarbeit mit Produktion, Planung, Qualitätssicherung, Logistik,
Disposition, Änderungsmanagement und IT zur Optimierung von
Schnittstellen.
○ Einsatz von GPRS-Trackern zur Überwachung und Einhaltung enger
Zeitfenster in der LKW-Logistik (seit 2013).
● 09/2015 – 11/2022 | Projektleiter Entwicklung | Auto.comug (Selbstständig)
○ Leitung der Entwicklung eines Plasma-Applikators für Verbrennungsmotoren.
○ Während dieser Selbstständigkeit Konstruktion von ASMEs , Betrieb eines
eigenen Motorprüfstands und Einsatz diverser Messgeräte (z.B.
Abgasmessgerät, Ozonmessgerät). Patent: WO 2019 024961 A1
● 07/2017 | Fachkraft für Lagerlogistik (IHK) | IHK Niederbayern, Landshut
○ Nur Prüfung abgelegt.
● 02/2018 – 11/2018 | Industriemeister / Logistikmeister (IHK) | IHK
Niederbayern, Landshut
● 12/2018 – 12/2020 | Einkauf, Prototypenbau | Geminitech GmbH
○ Verantwortlich für den Einkauf im Prototypenbau für Gesamtfahrzeuge (z.B.
Porsche 910/917).
○ Begleitung aller Projektphasen, von der Konzeption bis zur Fabrikgestaltung
(Luxusbus Tarrucas mit wandelbaren Möbeln, diverse Dachboxen).
○ Koordination der Fertigung von Komponenten (z.B. Windschutzscheiben,
Siebdruckaufkleber, Radnaben aus Titan, Lenkhebel aus Titan) mit Designern
und spezialisierten Herstellern (Slowenien, Serbien).
● 01/2021 – 06/2021 | Meister Logistik | Hirotec
○ Begleitung der SAP-Implementierung zur Optimierung logistischer Prozesse.
○ Koordination logistischer Abläufe.
● 01/2023 – 06/2023 | Stellv. Tiefbauingenieur | Eder Brunnenbau GmbH
○ Leitung von Bohr- und Baggertrupps.
○ Stellvertretende Leitung einer 250 km langen Baustelle.
● 11/2023 – 07/2024 | Technischer Vertrieb im Außendienst | Ludwig und Rosa
Baumgartner OHG
○ Technischer Außendienst.
Weitere Kenntnisse:
● EDV: SAP (MM, PP), MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Power BI
(konzeptionell).
● Sprachen: Deutsch (Muttersprache); Englisch (gut in Wort und Schrift);
Slowenisch (verhandlungssicher); Serbokroatisch (verhandlungssicher).
Hochmotiviert, meine Fähigkeiten in spannende Projekte einzubringen und gemeinsam
mit Ihnen die digitale Transformation von Prozessen voranzutreiben, um die Effizienz
und Innovationskraft des Unternehmens weiter zu steigern, freue ich mich auf die
Gelegenheit, in einem persönlichen Gespräch detaillierter zu erörtern, wie meine
Expertise Ihre Anforderungen optimal erfüllen kann.
Mit freundlichen Grüßen
Sebastian Plewnik
